content: So I'm feeling a bit lost about what's going on again. I'm taking a look at our skill tree to try and get centered.
Clearly it's fallen somewhat out of date.

By the way, @Jack Huey, I spent some time looking at the skill tree and thinking about how to make it more usefully convey the level of information I think we want. I am now thinking that I definitely want it to be higher-level.

I'll try to mock up in mermaid I think the general idea of what it should look like, I think.

It'd probably be useful to try to reserve some time to talk about rustc-integration and bottom out a bit more the skill tree and steps needed.

I'm feeling particularly a bit stalled about how to start work on the task of extracting a rustc shared type library. Though really I suspect the thing we need to resolve first is likely "how to resolve the late-bound index question" (do we want to keep a vector of binders in rustc? should we assign indices? etc)
I can make some time next week sometime after our Tuesday meeting to discuss rustc-integration. So whenever works for you.
As far as the rustc shared type library, I do agree that there are some unresolved questions
Params sort of fall under that discussion
it's really the only pain point as far as differences between chalk and rustc go
